name: Biscuit Topped Chickpea Pot Pie
description: Comfort food never tasted so good with this Biscuit Topped Chickpea Pot Pie! It features a vegan cheddar biscuit topping and is full of vegetables and chickpeas.
recipeIngredient: 3 cups frozen mixed vegetables (carrots, corn, green beans, peas)
1 large russet potato, peeled and chopped small
15 ounces (1 can) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
1 cup vegan cheddar cheese shreds, optional

itemListElement.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F and lightly oil a 9 x 13 inch casserole dish.
itemListElement.name: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F and lightly oil a 9 x 13 inch casserole dish.

itemListElement.text: Heat the olive oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Add the onions and garlic and cook for 2-3 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Heat the olive oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet. Add the onions and garlic and cook for 2-3 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Stir in the flour, then slowly pour in the vegetable broth and then the almond milk. Bring to boil and stir or whisk until smooth and slightly thickened, about 2 minutes. Now add the mixed vegetables, chopped potato and drained/rinsed chickpeas. Simmer for 5-10 minutes, until the sauce thickens. Add salt, to taste.
itemListElement.name: Stir in the flour, then slowly pour in the vegetable broth and then the almond milk. Bring to boil and stir or whisk until smooth and slightly thickened, about 2 minutes. Now add the mixed vegetables, chopped potato and drained/rinsed chickpeas. Simmer for 5-10 minutes, until the sauce thickens. Add salt, to taste.

itemListElement.text: Transfer the filling into the casserole dish and bake for 15 minutes while you make the biscuit topping.
itemListElement.name: Transfer the filling into the casserole dish and bake for 15 minutes while you make the biscuit topping.

itemListElement.text: In a large bowl, stir the flour, baking powder and salt together. Then pour in the melted butter and almond milk and mix with a spoon to combine. Stir in the cheese if using.
itemListElement.name: In a large bowl, stir the flour, baking powder and salt together. Then pour in the melted butter and almond milk and mix with a spoon to combine. Stir in the cheese if using.

itemListElement.text: Remove the casserole dish from the oven after 15 minutes, and quickly drop about 1/4 cup of the biscuit dough at a time, evenly, over the pot pie filling.
itemListElement.name: Remove the casserole dish from the oven after 15 minutes, and quickly drop about 1/4 cup of the biscuit dough at a time, evenly, over the pot pie filling.

itemListElement.text: Return the dish to the oven and bake for another 20-25 minutes or so, until the biscuits are cooked through and golden brown. Sprinkle with parsley, if desired and serve.
itemListElement.name: Return the dish to the oven and bake for another 20-25 minutes or so, until the biscuits are cooked through and golden brown. Sprinkle with parsley, if desired and serve.

keywords: biscuit pot pie, chickpea pot pie, vegetarian pot pie
